page.title: 16Carlton Curlieu
page.content: The village has mains electricity but no mains gas. An underground reservoir was built on Carlton Clump in 1936 and this still supplies water to some parts of the village not too successfully. The village also has mains water from Leicester. There is no public transport serving the village and no mobile shops. The Parish Church of St. Mary the Virgin stands in a delightful and well kept churchyard is of an old foundation being granted before 1081 to the Abbey of St. Eurol. There was a priest in Carlton in 1086. There is no longer a rector living in the parish which is amalgamated with six other local parishes. Services are held in rotation, and sunday school for young children and a teenage group called the God Squad.
